page.title: 11Recreation, Swainby & Potto
page.content: There is no official{playing field}in Swainby or Potto; all efforts to find a suitable site for a play area have so far failed.The school field is used only in school hours but children use the Cricket Club's ground; football is played in the Black Horse field.{Horse {riding}is increasingly popular, with at least 34 horses in the two villages and a riding school nearby.{Active} {pursuits}include jogging, cycling and motor cycling, while bowls and tennis players use nearby courts,and swimmers go to Stokesley baths.Other activities are bird watching, astronomy, photo- graphy, CB radio, local history and handicrafts.{Gardening}is perhaps the most popular recreation, extra effort being put in when the villages enter Britain in Bloom or Best Kept Village competitions.{Indoor recreations} include darts, discos and television.
